alert.note: Alert for Manua; Swains Island; Tutuila and Aunuu (American Samoa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS American Samoa (Pago Pago, American Samoa)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued January 11 at 1:58PM SST by NWS American Samoa
info.description: ...Threat of Flash Flooding Thursday through Saturday for all islands of American Samoa... The South Pacific Convergence Zone (SPCZ) to the south of the territory will move closer to the islands by at least Thursday. The SPCZ, with embedded low-level pressure systems, will bring showers and thunderstorms across the islands through Saturday. The expected long-duration of rainfall across the territory will produce flooding along roadways and low-lying areas as well as landslides. Heavy downpours will also cause rapidly rising waters in ditches and drainages, leading to the overflowing of streams. Please continue to monitor our website at www.weather.gov/ppg and NOAA Weather Radio for additional information. You may also see occasional updates on our social media pages.

area.areaDesc: Manua; Swains Island; Tutuila and Aunuu
